intro: Mahya, commonly known as wild thyme, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and features small, pink or white flowers. Its leaves are fragrant and often used in cooking or as a herbal remedy. Mahya thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a hardy and versatile plant.
